resources.string: No maps have been imported.\nUse the + button to import a map.
Show a list of map resources from the CPW website. The following resources will work with this app:
See Help for more detailed instructions.
Leaving this app and starting your browser. Once your map has downloaded, please return to this app to import it.
Open File Picker to select PDF maps that you downloaded. They will be copied into this app.

Go mobile with this offline PDF map viewer. Pinpoints your current location on PDF maps from the Hunting Atlas, Fishing Atlas, CPW Maps Library, or any georeferenced PDF. No need for internet or cell tower connection! Plus, access a list of resources for downloading PDF maps.

The Imported Maps page contains all the maps that you have downloaded and imported. These maps are copied into this app\'s data folder so that the map data is still available to use when you go mobile. Each imported map displays: the map name, file size, and current distance from the map in miles. See Add Map, Edit Map, and View Map sections below to add, rename, delete, or view a map.
If you are on the map, the location icon, pictured above, will be displayed.
Click on the + button on the Imported Maps page to download or import a map.
Click on a map to display the map, view current location, zoom in or out, and add waypoints.
Long press on a map to change the map name, delete the map, or view it\'s file size and latitude, longitude boundaries.

Click on the Open Browser button to download a map. Note that this requires an internet connection. It will notify you that it is starting up your browser app. Then it will load a page from the CPW website with resources to download georeferenced PDFs. Use one of the resources described below to download a map.
Click on \'Maps Library page\'. Select file type, GeoPDF, and press \'Search\'. Click on a map name to download it.

Click on the \'Colorado Hunting Atlas\' or the \'Colorado Fishing Atlas\'. Select your map layers by tapping on the menu icon in the top-left. Set your zoom level. Then press the down arrow icon. It will allow you to change: map scale, map size, and orientation. Smaller map scales will show more detail. Larger map sizes will show larger map areas. Enter a PDF file name and press the Create PDF button. Wait for it to be created and then press Download PDF.

Click on \'Forest Service topographical maps for free\' under Hunting. Below the map that loads, click on \'here\' to open the map viewer as full screen. Search by name or use the +/- buttons to zoom in or out. When the forest service individual map boundaries are showing click on one of the rectangles. Then in the popup box, click the \'>\' icon. Lastly, click on \'Download PDF\'.

Click on \'U.S. Geological Survey Store\' under Hunting. Then click on \'Map Locator Tool\'. Search for a location name with the \'Map Locator\' or use the +/- buttons to zoom in or out and double tap the map at the desired location. In the popup, click \'View Products\'. Click on the \'View PDF\' button on the most recent map. Click \'OK\' on the popup that says \'you are navigating away…\' It may download immediately. If it does not download, wait for it to display, click on the menu icon, and then click on \'download\'.

After you have downloaded PDF maps *go back to this app and import them by tapping on the File Picker button. Use the menu in the top-left to select from Recent, Documents, or Downloads folders. Or select the Google Drive icon if the file is located there. Click on the PDF file and it will import it and display the map. The map file is copied to the app directory so deleting the original will not affect the imported maps.
* Hint to get back to this app: click the back icon next to the home icon at the bottom of your phone.

Location:
Your current latitude and longitude will be displayed at the top of the map, and it will be displayed on the map as a cyan circle outlined in white.

Viewing the Map:
Double tap or pinch to zoom in or out. Drag to pan the map.

Waypoints:
To add waypoints, click on the push pin icon at the top-right, then click the map at the desired location. To cancel adding a waypoint, click again on the push pin icon at the top-right. If the waypoint label is showing, tapping on the map will hide it. Tapping on a waypoint will display it's label. Tapping on a waypoint label will let you edit the label and pushpin color. Long-pressing on a waypoint with let you edit, delete, or move the waypoint.
